column2: Bengali: [ˈbɔraɦˌnɔɡor] (listen)) is a city and municipality of North 24 Parganas district in the Indian state of West Bengal. It is close to Kolkata and also a part of the area covered by Kolkata Metropolitan Development Authority (KMDA).It is home to the Indian Statistical Institute
column3: an institution of national importance devoted to the research
column5: natural sciences and social sciences. Baranagore Ramakrishna Mission Ashrama High School is one of the oldest and most renowned schools in Baranagar and North 24 Parganas.Baranagar is a major industrial centre for the manufacture of agricultural and industrial machinery
column8: and matches; there are also numerous cotton-processing companies.

column1: The word Baranagar derives from the Bengali term Barahanagore (Bengali: বরাহনগর)
column2: meaning "City of the Hogs". (বরাহ: hog

column1: Streynsham Master who visited the area in 1676 spoke of the hog factory where about 3
column2: 000 hogs a year were slaughtered and salted for export.There are several explanations for the etymology of this name:
meaning the "big" (Bara or Barra) and "town or land" (nagar) of the "pig" (baraha).

column1: Baranagar Municipality was established in 1869; it is one of the oldest municipalities in India. The Dutch had homes here in the seventeenth century. Streynsham Master who visited the area in 1676 spoke of the hog factory where about 3
column2: 000 hogs a year were slaughtered and salted for export. Later it became the centre for the extensive jute trade
column3: manufacturing gunny bags. A major road (Surya Sen Road) parallel to the Hooghly river connects Baranagar Bazaar with Dakshineswar. In between temples such as Kaancher Mandir (i.e. Glass Temple)
column4: Joy Mitra Kali Bari and Pathbari are located.

column2: still there is an old house/lodge of Dutch merchants.

column1: Baranagar is located at 22.64°N 88.37°E﻿ / 22.64; 88.37. It has an average elevation of 12 metres (39 feet). It is situated east of the Hooghly River. Baranagar Municipal area lies between Sinthee More and Dunlop.

column2: the boundary of Baranagar is :- in the east – the Rail line from Sealdah towards Krishnanagar; in the west – the holy river Ganga
column3: in the north – Dakshineshwar and PWD Road and in the south – Cossipore and Sinthee. Dakshineshwar Kali Temple lies just a quarter of a mile from this place. There are many Ganga ghats in Baranagar for example Pramanic ghat
column5: Kancher mandir or glass temple ghat etc.

column1: Baranagar Road railway station is situated in Baranagar. It is a Kolkata suburban railway station. It is one of the oldest railway station. Sealdah - Dankuni line's trains pass through this station.
Noapara metro station is situated at Noapara in Baranagar. It is Kolkata Metro's largest station.

The extension of Kolkata Metro Line 1 from Dum Dum to Dakshineswar was sanctioned in 2010-11. It was extended up to Noapara in 2013. The subsequent work was held up because of the encroachments on railway land. The state government has taken steps to remove the encroachment and work is expected to make progress. Baranagar metro station is under construction adjacent to Baranagar Road railway station. As of July 2018
column2: the earliest it can be expected to be in operation is September 2019
column3: but may get delayed up to early 2020.

column1: Barrackpore Trunk Road (part of both SH 1 and SH 2) passes through Baranagar. Belghoria Expressway also passes through Baranagar. Dunlop Crossing is one of the largest crossings near Kolkata which connects Kolkata with Northern suburban areas and Howrah
column2: Hooghly. Another important road is Gopal Lal Tagore Road which is connected to B.T. Road at Sinthee More (via Kashi Nath Dutta Road)
column3: at Tobin More (via Baghajatin Road) and also at Dunlop. Gopal Lal Tagore Road is also connected to Dakshineswar via Deshbandhu Road-Surya Sen Road (through Alambazar). Many buses ply along all these roads.

column1: Baranagar houses the headquarters of the Indian Statistical Institute at Bonhooghly. It is an academic institute of national importance as recognised by a 1959 act of the Indian parliament. Established in 1931
column2: this public university of India is focused on statistics.

column1: Baranagar Math near Pramanick ghat is the place where Swami Vivekananda and a few other disciples of Sri Ramakrishna Dev started their spiritual journey that culminated in forming the monastic order later located at Belur Math
column2: the present headquarters of Ramakrishna Mission. Other places worth visiting are Jay Mitra Kalibari
column4: and Kouleswar Mandir. Pathbari Mandir is a place where Chaitanya Mahaprabhu
column6: set his foot on his way to Puri nearly five hundred years ago here. In Baranagar a math has been set up very recently
column7: called Alambazar Math in the heritage building where Swami Vivekananda first put up after coming back from abroad.

column1: The Annapurna Temple and the newly built Omkarnath Temple are also other two attractions of the "Mahamilan Math". Trailanga Swami Math is also here in Baranagar at Vidyayatan Sarani. There is also an old kalibari in Baranagar Bazar and one in Kutighat and Pramanicghat.
